organization.fullName: Abramson Cancer Center at Penn Medicine

identificationModule.briefTitle: Mechanisms, Predictors, and Social Determinants of Cardiotoxicity in Breast Cancer
identificationModule.officialTitle: Cardiotoxicity of Cancer Therapy 2: Mechanisms, Predictors, and Social Determinants of Health in Breast Cancer Patients Treated With Doxorubicin and/or Trastuzumab

leadSponsor.name: Abramson Cancer Center at Penn Medicine

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is an observational study for patients with breast cancer that will be treated with doxorubicin (Adriamycin) and/or trastuzumab (Herceptin). The study will help the investigators learn more about how these medications affect the heart and how those effects relate to patients' medical history and social determinants of health (such as race, gender identity, education, occupation, access to health services and economic resources). Patients on this study will have echocardiograms, blood draws, and answer questions about their symptoms and activity level. Patients will be followed on this study for up to 15 years.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The investigators propose a prospective longitudinal cohort of breast cancer patients treated with anthracyclines and/or trastuzumab to determine the associations between social determinants of health (SDOH) and cardiotoxicity risk and to determine whether associations between SDOH and cardiotoxicity risk differ according to race. Patients will be followed with serial echo, blood draw, and surveys every 3 months for the first year, then annually for two years. After 3 years following start of cancer therapy, patients will have study visits every other year for up to 15 years.

conditions: Drug-Related Side Effects and Adverse Reactions

bioSpec.description: Plasma, Serum, and buffy coat will be banked.

armGroups.label: Doxorubicin
armGroups.description: Patients treated with doxorubicin (Adriamycin) for breast cancer

armGroups.label: Trastuzumab
armGroups.description: Patients treated with trastuzumab (Herceptin) for breast cancer

armGroups.label: Doxorubicin and Trastuzumab
armGroups.description: Patients treated with both doxorubicin (Adriamycin) and trastuzumab (Herceptin) for breast cancer

interventions.name: Social Determinants of Health
interventions.description: The study will perform detailed phenotyping of Social Determinants of Health using the National Institute of Minority Health and Health Disparities PhenX SDOH toolkit at baseline.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF)
primaryOutcomes.description: Absolute change in LVEF by echocardiogram at follow-up
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Incidence of CTRCD defined as at least a 10% absolute change in LVEF by echocardiogram at follow-up relative to baseline to a value \< 50%
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Incidence of symptomatic heart failure (centrally adjudicated)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in longitudinal strain by echo from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in circumferential strain by echo from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in diastolic function defined as E/e' by echo from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in LV Mass by echo from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Relative LV Wall Thickness
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in relative LV wall thickness from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in Ventricular-Arterial Coupling defined as Ea/Ees by echo from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in LV Twist measured by 3D echo from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in LV Torsion measured by 3D echo from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in NTproBNP measured in batches from banked samples from baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in hs-TnT measured in batches from banked samples from baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in Patient Reported Outcomes Information System (PROMIS) Fatigue Score from baseline. A higher score corresponds to higher reported levels of fatigue.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in patient reported quality of life
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in Patient Reported Outcomes Information System (PROMIS) Global Health score from baseline. Higher scores indicate a healthier patient.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in patient reported activity level
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in total weekly leisure activity in METS assessed by Godin Leisure Time Exercise Questionnaire from baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion (expected to be 15 years)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Women older than 18 years of age
* Breast cancer with treatment plan that includes doxorubicin and/or trastuzumab
* Ability to provide written informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* Pregnancy at enrollment
* Inability or unwillingness to provide consent
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients will be recruited from the medical oncology practices at the Abramson Cancer Center.
